page.title: 01BASILDON: NORTH EAST AREA
page.content:
{Basildon,}mentioned in the original {Domesday Book,}is approximately 30 miles from London. It was designated a {New Town}following the end of the Second World War, when London was unable to cope with the housing of returning servicemen and their families.
This north east area is a mixture of farmland to the north, a central belt of light industry, and housing and recreational space to the south. It has no real character because the movement of people in and out of the area has not allowed a real community spirit to develop.
The local areas are Nevendon, Cranes Farm, Burnt Mills, Fryerns, Northlands and North Benfleet.
